section.title: Working with &product.name;

note.title: Important
note.para: In order to operate &product.name; properly, you must have javascript and cookies enabled in your browser.

section.title: Manage Toolbar
section.para: Once you have successfully logged in, the Manage Toolbar appears, which is the primary interface for working with &product.name;.
The toolbar includes, from left to right:

varlistentry.listitem: "Live" indicates the active branch. If you create another branch and view it, this indicator reports the new branch's name. Clicking the indicator presents a popup menu of available branches to view and common branch tasks. Please see for more details.
Presents a menu of management operations. Please see the description below.
Clicking Content displays the Manage Content screen, providing easy access to all of your site's content and content management features. Please see for more details.
Clicking Add begins the process of adding content. Please see for more details.
Clicking Widgets enables widget management mode that allows widgets to be added, configured, or deleted from regions specified by the active theme. Please see for more details.
Not shown is the Back to Website item, which only appears when you are viewing management pages, and when clicked displays the home page of your site.

Clicking the greeting presents a popup menu containing the options User Profile, which lets you access your &product.name; profile page, and Logout, which logs you out of &product.name; and ends your management session.

section.para: When a content page is being displayed, the toolbar includes some additional options:

varlistentry.listitem: Clicking Edit toggles content editing mode. Please see for more details.
Clicking History opens a sub-toolbar allowing you to explore previous versions of content. Please see for more details.

itemizedlist.listitem: Content: enables you to create content using &product.name; content types.
Content Types: enables you to create templates for content, to ensure consistency and per-type styling.
Categories: enables you to categorize your content, providing additional content navigation opportunities.
Workflows: enables you to specify states for your content that can specify conditions that must be met to transition to the next state, and actions to be taken during a state transition.
General Settings: manage your site's name, its description, and robots.txt configuration.
Menus: manage menus to provide navigation facilities in a web site.
Themes: manage themes, which control the overall styling of a web site.
Modules: manage extensions that can be added to a web site.
Users: add new users, edit or delete existing users.
Roles: define roles, which can be assigned to users to allow them to perform various kinds of management tasks.
Permissions: specify the tasks that each role can perform.
Site and Branches: manage the sites hosted by this instance of &product.name; and all the branches associated with each site.
System Information: reports on the current state of &product.name;, its modules and operating environment.
Add Site: add a new web site to your &product.name; installations.
